body:
Comment 3: 
I am no expert on the format. However, I've seen how people use these tokens. It looks
approximately like this:

SUM: OP " + " OP ;
DIFF: OP " - " OP ;

I.e. people use string tokens as an easy way to recognize strings. This can, of course
be replaced by the way I described in #0 or by putting them into lexer, but that
requires a bit more effort and decreases readability. That is especially relevant in the
presence of the fact that we don't have lexer yet (do we?).

Besides, it seems that cmd/yacc already has some support for it - so why not just fix it?
